page.title: 05Pebsham Gipsy Caravan Site
page.content: On land by the Pebsham Landfill Site the Rother District Council administers a permanent site for caravan dwellers.It opened in 1984.It has 12 hard standings for caravans, each with its own mains electricity point and water point and mains drainage,as well as a shower unit.Rent for each pitch is Â£11 per week.The site is landscaped and well appointed, with vehicle parking space and an area for carrying on the business of scrap dealing.Some of the site children attend W.St.Leonard's School,but others go to Saxon Mount and Torfield Special Schools and Grove Comprehensive School.School attendance is often irregular.The site caters for those living in E.Sussex for some time prior to applying for a place.The law now forbids gypsies to camp on unofficial sites in this area.
